Package br.com.kirgh.app.repositories

Interface UserRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<User,UUID>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<User,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<User,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<User,UUID>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<User>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<User,UUID>
public interface UserRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,UUID>
This line of code is defining an interface called UserRepository that extends the JpaRepository interface. The JpaRepository interface is a Spring Data interface that provides methods for performing common database operations on a specific entity type (User in this case). The second parameter of JpaRepository (UUID) specifies the type of the primary key for the User entity. Therefore, UserRepository inherits all the methods of JpaRepository and can also define additional methods specific to the User entity.

  • Method Details

    • existsByEmail

      boolean existsByEmail(String email)
      The function checks if an email exists in a database or list.
      Parameters:
      email - The email parameter is a string that represents an email address. The method existsByEmail checks if there is any record in a database or list that matches the given email address. It returns a boolean value, true if the email exists in the database or list, and false if it does not exist.
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned. The method is checking whether an email exists in a system or database and will return true if it does exist and false if it does not exist.

    • existsByCpf

      boolean existsByCpf(String cpf)
      The function checks if a record exists in a database by its CPF (Brazilian ID) number.
      Parameters:
      cpf - The cpf parameter is a string representing a Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification number, also known as "Cadastro de Pessoas FÃ­sicas" (CPF). It is a unique identifier assigned to each Brazilian citizen or resident for tax and administrative purposes. The method existsByCpf is
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned. The method name existsByCpf suggests that it checks whether a record exists in a database or collection based on a given CPF (Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification) number. If a record with the given CPF exists, the method will return true, otherwise it will return false.

    • findAll

      org.springframework.data.domain.Page<User> findAll(org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification spec, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      The function findAll returns a page of users that match the given specification and pageable parameters.
      Parameters:
      spec - The spec parameter is a Specification object that defines the criteria for filtering the results. It allows you to dynamically build complex queries based on various conditions.
      pageable - The pageable parameter is used to specify the pagination settings for the query results. It includes information such as the page number, the number of items per page, and the sorting criteria. This allows you to retrieve a specific page of results from the query.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Page object containing a list of User objects that match the given Specification, with pagination applied according to the provided Pageable object.

    • deleteUserById

      @Transactional @Modifying @Query(nativeQuery=true, value=" DELETE FROM\n users\n WHERE\n id = :userId\n") void deleteUserById(@Param("userId") UUID userId)
      The function deletes a user from the database based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The userId parameter is of type UUID and represents the unique identifier of the user that needs to be deleted from the users table.
